document.title: Content Standards and Grade Level Expectations English Program 2022

8AC89692A85644E68A88F95ED0A01067.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, domain-specific, and content area words and phrases. Gather
vocabulary knowledge when considering a word or phrase important to comprehension or expression.

DBB35A8C8E994802980A8484F5027CF4.description:
Accurately use a variety of social, academic, and content-specific words and phrases sufficient for reading, writing, speaking,
and listening at the college and career-readiness level.

F5973E60BC184DE3A7FAD20120C15F97.description:
Distinguish among the different connotations (associations) and denotations (definitions)
of words (e.g., bullheaded, willful, firm, persistent, resolute).

5AC7452556F746B3B5A1276576C2C517.description: Interpret figures of speech (e.g., verbal irony, puns) in context.

F4EB4177432443C0B023AA6495040E03.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

500E100740024312B2C1A28482FF1C35.description: Demonstrate understanding of figurative language, word relationships, and variation in word meanings.

BED839494D1A41418970E86A9A539214.description:
Consult print and digital reference materials (e.g., dictionaries, glossaries, thesauri) to find
the pronunciation of a word or determine or clarify its precise meaning or its part of speech.

4051EA83183C466095A4BDBB9CF44306.description: Use common Greek or Latin affixes and roots correctly (e.g., ex-, inter-, anti-, micro-).

10151ABECD044D3A941C2C5B5EE408AE.description: Use context clues to help determine the meaning of a word or phrase.

05B1A83110894496B62C2701A33D4FFC.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words or phrases through grade-level appropriate reading and content, choosing flexibly from a variety of strategies.

1B4D660B15F14AA8A8AE536E7FFEFDF5.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and phrases by using context clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting reference materials.

2D79E1431F5B4E31BDB9AE4F6B07C625.description: Choose language that expresses ideas clearly, recognizing direct and indirect objects and eliminating wordiness and redundancy.

FD7B72367DC442F8A649A5E8B8B6288A.description: Use knowledge of language and its conventions when writing, speaking, reading, or listening.

5188948E17F043C097CDD239996F0BA8.description: Demonstrate understanding of how language functions in different contexts, making effective choices for meaning, style, and comprehension.

5D5E595B8BB04601BBCD06D7B72D0FCE.description: Spell grade-appropriate words correctly, consulting references as needed.

4014A199F5FB4C6FB01F1A735E72914B.description: Use advanced punctuation (e.g., commas, ellipses, dashes) correctly.

6AB3BD1B25284C849403F4D10EEEF95B.description: Demonstrate command of English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions when writing.

2A612CB445B74AEA8A0399849389FA91.description: Apply appropriate English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling conventions.

DFAB8B37D9F2496AACA084F1A40C3641.description: Form and use verbs in the active and passive voice.

09E353ED19B847E08BED68A5991BDFA9.description: Explain the functions and tenses of different kinds of verbs and apply them correctly.

A3FA0CC9C58A4A47B42E9815A1F18ED8.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions when writing and speaking.

AFFF0B5CF5964184BF8839035A275BCA.description: Demonstrate command of English grammar and usage conventions.

7D38EAC5E5654F2989D53B8B935CCF2D.description: Analyze to arrange/write essays, stories, autobiographies, and/or research.

0444F4D48B024C4F9F3032067E7ABC84.description: Analyze to respond to letters, reflections, and revisions.

1AC4F82EFF2542F1941FCE772E2DD505.description:
Write routinely for short and extended periods of time (e.g., time for research, reflection, and revision) for a variety of discipline-specific tasks, purposes (including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive, and descriptive
writing), and audiences and demonstrate knowledge of their qualities.

ECA1E5B51D584DEA84E85D79985D1B88.description: Write routinely over short and extended periods of time for a variety of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

5832138A35594607BB8D0833551EE161.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

4B2A5A076E254507AF5468AB6CA7BAF4.description: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection, and research.

7A943ABC2D464BA69D7EC06A97CA34AB.description:
Assess the credibility and accuracy of each source and quote or paraphrase the data and
conclusions of others to avoid plagiarism.

01CC88A2D9654762AA12FB88E9F71A9C.description:
Recall relevant information from experiences or gather relevant information from print and
digital sources using search terms effectively.

287A69B9BDA34C01A674C623BDC0E87A.description:
Participate in or conduct research to gather information that answers questions about a
single topic using multiple sources.

0E7EAC800F7E47B2947A93E7E02574BC.description: Conduct short research projects to write a report that answers a question, drawing on several sources and refocusing the inquiry when appropriate.

3F06E4BB2FED4F149B61D4A947BD4FEA.description: Conduct research projects of varying lengths based on focused questions to demonstrate understanding of the subject.

7F601BB5D03440CD968338F285D0913B.description:
Use technology, including the internet, to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with
others.

15284C0B010E4B91AB9B13532A083A9E.description: Use technology, including the internet, to interact and collaborate with others to produce and publish writing.

908AB3E7C7AA4AF0B1D422788DDF684C.description:
Focus on how well purpose and audience have been addressed, avoiding plagiarism, using
citations, according to style guides (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

211DD23B83AC4A6B8BFFB514269DD63A.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by planning, drafting, revising, editing (using editing marks),
rewriting, and publishing.

48171ABCF39445A5BD444037DA383C33.description:
Develop and strengthen writing as needed by using the writing process (planning, drafting, revising, editing, rewriting, and
publishing).

F277035879EA43CE81F89EB4E9C2C978.description: Use effective technique, relevant descriptive details, and well-structured event sequences.

F188CBC69F8C4E14AB186D7AEF130A3F.description: Write literary texts using transitional words and other cohesive devices to better organize writing and develop real or imagined experiences or events in 4 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

2C1D678D424D442B969C7851AAC15721.description: Write literary texts to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, details, and structure.

1CED39C4B00E4080B8EAEE97BA0DBA39.description: Use precise language and domain-specific vocabulary to inform about or explain the topic.

7D8A74DECA9B4ED394A4A4842FC7F86B.description: Use appropriate transitions to clarify relationships among ideas and concepts.

3DA238859A364ED9B6B7283EB4DE7A12.description: Introduce a topic or thesis statement. Organize ideas, concepts, and information.

964E1ACFA67C4F5F8C7CE4F00D64A67F.description: Write informational texts to examine a topic and convey ideas, concepts, and information through the selection, organization and analysis of relevant content in 4 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

EA6F17CF45164588BB59FF71C3DB61C8.description:
Write informational texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and accurately through the
selection, organization, and analysis of relevant content.

7648AC52E8CA4EBDB8E3831011042AA8.description: Use reliable sources to demonstrate understanding of the topic or text.

A73E313EEA88471AAF554E694D759566.description: Support claim(s) or counterarguments with logical reasoning and relevant evidence.

2F1752B38A7346FFA9CB543BD209988E.description: Express and clarify viewpoints and opinions. Take and defend positions.

700AF36231824BF4BDACF223D2B27324.description: Justify opinions or persuade others by providing textual evidence or relevant background knowledge with moderate support in a composition of 4 or more paragraphs of 6 or more sentences each.

7E540DF6BEC4431398EC63CBF7FFF559.description: Write arguments to support point of view using valid reasoning and relevant evidence.

4306487EBEED4D21ABC18146058670F3.description:
Read and comprehend a variety of literature (e.g., stories, dramas, and poetry) and informational texts (e.g.,
history, social studies, science, and technical texts) of appropriate complexity.

11F2B565720E4FBC8886A6A6BE5CF962.description: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently.

2415D0A245B34FEC983A7E5809F65253.description:
Analyze how 2 or more authors writing about the same topic shape their presentations of key information by emphasizing different evidence or advancing different interpretations of facts in
informational texts.

5DC87A75A22E4B518F221FD348EA734B.description: Compare and contrast a fictional portrayal of a time, place, or character and a historical account of the same period as a means of understanding how authors of fiction use or alter history.

9DD1EEC5095F40E881279F642045B162.description: Compare and contrast 2 or more authors’ presentations of similar themes or topics.

9487A973E91B42608A31FEEE17E5B953.description:
Identify and evaluate the argument and specific evidence in a text, assessing whether the reasoning is sound and the evidence is relevant and sufficient to support the claims (including, but not limited to, narrative, persuasive,
and descriptive writing and knowledge of their qualities).

6DBD00AA40BA42DC946D0A9594096120.description: Delineate and evaluate an author’s argument through evidence specified in a text.

FBEAD56AB38F4835BED9CF8E3E75339A.description:
Compare and contrast an informational text to an audio, video, or multimedia version of the text,
analyzing each medium’s portrayal of the subject (e.g., how the delivery of a speech affects the
impact of the words).

3686B763AEAB4BB9928AAA81F5A2F7B9.description:
Compare and contrast a written story, drama, or poem with its audio, filmed, staged, or multimedia version, analyzing the effects of techniques unique to each medium (e.g., lighting, sound, color, or
camera focus and angles in a film) using English subtitles.

A20722A293CE4B5EA685EF7E641F725B.description: Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats.

E77F51DF6DEA470BA440FD480EF5A139.description:
Determine an author’s point of view or purpose in an informational text and analyze how the
author distinguishes his or her position from others.

8CB179BC5F6240AD8DB728A967AB143F.description:
Analyze how an author develops and contrasts the points of view of different characters or
narrators in a literary text.

E528A9D681474CBEBA750591724D02E3.description: Assess how point of view or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

DF56AF715D024A6D9E015F62DC67C054.description:
Analyze the structure an author uses to organize an informational text, including how the major
sections contribute to the development of the ideas and to the whole.

E02E3130F275416E9B42FF213B29EEC8.description: Analyze how the structure of a drama or poem contributes to its meaning (e.g., soliloquy, sonnet).

32593842E2D34208A41EDADB47EFDA5F.description:
Analyze the structure of a text, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text (e.g., sections,
chapters, scenes, or stanzas) relate to each other and to the whole.

D1A9C5B74718445094F1EE4CE0713E13.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in an informational text, including
figurative, connotative, and technical meanings. Analyze the impact of a specific word choice on meaning and tone.

71DB38AE3A174451A93ECD1B30F5D94E.description:
Determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a literary text, including figurative and connotative meanings. Analyze the impact of rhymes and other repetitions of
sounds (e.g., alliteration) on a specific verse or stanza of a poem or section of a story or drama.

4E4528D65A084D61B0EA5BD46C013BC0.description:
Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text, determining technical, connotative, and figurative meanings. Analyze
how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

A3CB76EEF0FB4E83B351914CCD00953B.description: Analyze the interactions between individuals, events, and ideas in an informational text (e.g., how ideas influence individuals or events or how individuals influence ideas or events).

33F11A9128EB4725A361C845B5446042.description:
Analyze how particular elements of a story or drama interact (e.g., how setting shapes the
characters or plot).

6866C74FD53A46BCA6F7BDD7D7D56FE3.description: Analyze how and why individuals, events, or ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

A2C3B8CAEA3F42C4B3B3CC9EA84BFF46.description:
Determine one or more main ideas in an informational text and analyze their development over
the course of the text. Provide an objective summary of the text.

A89EDE2A57664714AC195F4345719B5F.description:
Determine a theme or main idea of a literary text and analyze its development over the course
of the text. Provide an objective summary of the text.

00C1D6F2ED79434CA2DBD8383AC0AF45.description: Determine main ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development. Summarize the key supporting details and ideas.

90381A3E90DE43E3A91C2D714C2E4B75.description: Identify facts/details that support main idea(s) from the texts.

C02353959B3A43D9B8D14F19CDE1E959.description:
Read a variety of grade-level texts and multimedia resources (when available) to explain ideas, phenomena, processes, cultural identities, genres, and text relationships, supplying textual evidence to support analyses and
conclusions drawn from the text.

A449F92D337243278B1CF66FF2FA9001.description: Read critically to make logical inferences and cite specific textual evidence to support conclusions drawn from the text.

135171E731B44F658AB7335FAE734C95.description:
Use context to confirm or self-correct word recognition and understanding, rereading as
necessary.

CB3887CD2941470980F445C2E5C4CA1A.description:
Accurately read on-level prose and poetry orally with appropriate expression and rate on
successive readings.

E41E1B710DFD4C08837884161E0395C1.description: Read on-level texts with purpose and understanding.

EF58A4739D604144BACCF87054EFE9A4.description: Read with sufficient accuracy and fluency to support comprehension.

E80409240F7B4603A76158C4739179A1.description:
Process encoding sounds through letters (s, r), consonant blends (sh, sk), digraphs (ay, ew), or
trigraphs (sch, thr) using conventional spelling patterns to form words.

A45829F79EE94CB0B1795B2F2487D801.description: Apply meaning to single units of sound in existing word parts to encode a given word.

0DCE4838528D407B9DF834FA8DB3B90D.description:
Accurately read multisyllabic words using a combined knowledge of all letter-sound
correspondences and syllabication patterns.

5DD6221C047D4A829B54E860871AA507.description:
Use a combined knowledge of strategies to decode grade-level monosyllabic and multisyllabic
words.

88C5F822894A4F24B95954EF11136740.description: Understand and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to decode and encode words.

46BBF8EC8DD04F3F9C07AE41AEA3FD05.description: Refer to previous grades to reinforce these skills if necessary.

65496241BE0F4F1499409748F1B8FE05.description: Phonological awareness (rhyming, blending, segmentation, deletion, isolation, substitution)

E8C031E78A2A43C8A5447D2C234A3DD2.description: Provide reference information of source(s) applying required MLA and APA student format.

DF7DA3BD986442229DA36B043FE49BB1.description:
Cite or paraphrase the data and conclusions of others avoiding plagiarism and following a
standard format for citation (e.g., MLA and APA student format).

414D54CCAA774A059B6D15880A07C01B.description: Recognize and gather relevant information from multiple reliable print and digital sources.

FF0D377412454ECF9333002B512E7258.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print.

2C64FFFD1D5C41F2ACE31C6F10CE4F98.description: Plan and deliver oral presentations on a variety of topics, citing specific textual evidence to support ideas (e.g., integrating technology or digital/print resources).

898DAC4F235C41459F439668AF1AD355.description:
Plan and deliver different types of oral presentations/reports to express information and support ideas in social, academic,
college, and career settings.

C3A64A5D7A7A4CF58D37357448E373F9.description: Adjust language choices according to purpose, task, and audience.

970F8047C4C4427897EBE45C312392DC.description:
Make predictions/inferences and draw conclusions from listening to a variety of texts,
performances, and multimedia sources.

29FA7358F8A24FD1850A876A5ADD6B5B.description:
Express thoughts and opinions to discuss current events, concepts, themes, characters, plot,
and conflict resolution.

4CE65B0AC13642339F886C3D533F63CD.description: Describe, explain, and evaluate the text, self, and real-world experience.

C0FEE8670A1F4DB9A20FBEB1DC7FC27C.description: Adjust language choices according to the task, context, purpose, and audience.

96768FAFE7D94F8EAE2C11D176B2ECE4.description:
Express and defend opinions and subtle differences and viewpoints from peers, texts, and
others.

704C812821804F82B877B6BDEAE658BC.description: Use an expanded number of learned phrases and/or creative or original responses.

71D4046545D44AB297506B989C180518.description:
Reach an agreement or persuade others to see the student’s point of view during class/partner discussions or
presentations/performances.

D6CA50A153904595B9F03C13BD657CE2.description: Provide, justify, and defend opinions or positions in speech.

CEACD8E7AAA148D5B2ABFB103B4D9E36.description:
Use a growing set of academic words, content-specific words, synonyms, and antonyms to tell, retell, explain, and analyze stories, personal experiences, and current/world events with increasing precision and understanding of
differences in meaning while speaking.

C066AE7C0F1549938152E841BE7BA4A5.description: Contribute to social, academic, college, and career conversations using accurate and appropriate language.

A9330D1309644AEA8A1F814CAF53ECE4.description: Describe, explain, support, discuss, and synthesize information to express self.

40893CD4D231478E9C2D31A6E0ADE298.description: Memorize, analyze, and follow increasingly complex instructions and directions.

CC34765115994040B3AC613EBFAAC92D.description: Formulate and answer closed- and open-ended questions

FC2E2E6591A84B33BBB07FC4143943A5.description: Evaluate information and determine appropriate responses to answer questions effectively.

2C84E6EA96FC41FA907928E88D56EDD1.description: Ask probing relevant questions to expand discussions.

427797B745324CCE9979E225BD0F3969.description: Contribute to class, group, and partner discussions by following turn-taking rules, asking relevant questions, concurring with others, adding relevant information, and paraphrasing key ideas.

9254E64E4A484DEBA8A25A6FC1424350.description:
Contribute to discussions on a variety of social, academic, college, and career topics in diverse contexts and with different
audiences.

9A154532A3BD4342AC1B984FB290D802.description: Listen to, respond to, analyze, give, and discuss complex instructions, statements, and directions.

893DDCB750FD4852B23702B6769E8AFA.description:
Listen and respond during read-alouds from a variety of literary and informational texts to demonstrate comprehension; generalize; make connections with character, setting, plot, and
solution; and identify tone and mood.

F96E72D585E44B31AEF7EC939A814551.description:
Take turns and show consideration by concurring with others. Extend ideas or arguments with
support from a teacher.

93B263511B874B35A6C7F012A6EA68B9.description:
Ask relevant questions that evoke elaboration and respond to others’ questions and comments
with relevant observations and ideas that build the discussion and keep the conversation on topic.

6691BF5B20C8489B8DEF5203F8F537ED.description: Listen and collaborate with peers during social interactions; read-alouds (fiction/nonfiction and literary/informational texts); oral presentations; and class, group, and partner discussions.

1442DB62E76F4694A5EBB0F09C940630.description:
Comprehend and analyze information from a variety of listening activities to ask and answer questions on social, academic,
college, and career topics.
